Oh, I did not know that Revo Uninstaller changed from freeware to non-free software. Revo Uninstaller used to be the only uninstaller that was actually well researched, not just a copy of the Windows uninstall feature with a registry cleaner. The problem was that many of these programs were so badly developed that they where dangerous. Revo Uninstaller worked great, but it had two big drawbacks though, it was not 64-bit compatible and not fully compatible with Windows 7. The new version corrects these drawbacks. I'm downloading it right away to give it a try.
